active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the limitations of relying solely on technical security controls (e.g., firewalls and encryption) versus integrating them with administrative and physical controls in a Defense in Depth model. Provide real-world examples from breaches like SolarWinds and support your arguments with NIST CSF functions.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Technical Security Controls within Defense in Depth (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Concepts and Principles > Foundational Security Principles > Defense in Depth > Technical Security Controls). Generate 25 high-quality flashcards using the provided schema. Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding Layers: Distribute 5-7 cards per layer [INSERT FULL LAYERS FROM ABOVE]. Progress from Layer 1 (foundation) to Layer 4 (integration). - Active Learning Tie-Ins: Include 3-5 cards inspired by discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving (e.g., scenario prompts). - Research Context: NIST CSF 2.0 (Govern/Identify/Protect/Detect/Respond/Recover), NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 (technical families: AC, AU, CM, IA, SC, SI; examples: firewalls-SC-7, encryption-SC-28, IDS-SI-4), ISO 27001, CIS Controls. Defense in Depth: layered technical (e.g., IDS/IPS), admin, physical controls protecting CIA triad. Output Format: JSON array of objects, each: {"id":1, "layer":1, "bloom_level":"REMEMBER", "front":"Question text", "back":{"answer":"Correct answer","explanation":"Detailed explanation with sources and distractor rationale if MCQ","source":"NIST SP 800-53"}}. For MCQs, include distractors in front (e.g., 'A. Opt1 B. Opt2 (correct) C. Opt3 D. Opt4') and explain all in back. Ensure active recall, no cues in front. Variety: 40% MCQ (plausible distractors per protocol), 30% Q&A, 20% apply scenarios, 10% create/critique. Make explanations 50-100 words for deep learning.
